channel.title: Setting up a VPS - Better then 12igon8's
channel.description:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,429240.0.html Mine beats that /flame
[hr]
[b]Pictures are Coming. I am ordering a VPS to get pictures inside the server :)[/b]
I see people still ask how to set up a VPS. Most guides use VPSLand.com, I personally wouldnt use them. Now here is a guide much better then 12igon8's guide and will provide you with more information.
I will write up a guide on setting up a VPS using a Linux computer soon
[hr]
[b]Forenote[/b]
If you have no experience with using VPS, I advise you to get a Windows Server. Some linux VPS providers do not allow Remote Desktop type connections and will only allow SSH. So get a Windows VPS if you havent used linux before :)
[b]Selecting your VPS[/b]
You should choose the VPS depending on the amount of players you have. Most servers (Delta) can run quite lagg-free on minimum 512MB of RAM (Random Access Memory). You should choose a company with a decent feedback list. I personally use Next Level These guys have very fast customer support with a support team based around the world, Very fast servers and No downtime at all. They also offer Webhosting for 2$ a month :D
Select your Operating System:
[url=http://nlvl.net/vps.php]Linux VPS[/url] [url=http://nlvl.net/windowsvps.php]Windows VPS[/url]
[b]Setting up a Windows VPS on Windows OS[/b]
After purchasing a VPS, You will be contacted by the Company providing the server with your Login Information. You will need the following to connect to your VPS
[ul][li]IP Address[/li] [li]Username (Usually Administrator)[/li] [li]Password[/li][/ul]
Open your 'Start' Menu Windows XP+: Search for 'run' and open it Windows XP-: Click 'Run' [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/259wlmo.png[/img]
In the run dialog type 'mstsc', A box like this should pop up: [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/153bh9d.png[/img] [hr] Enter your IP Address, Let it connect. Enter your Administrator username and the password given to you and your VPS is ready to set up :)
[b]Setting up a Linux VPS on Windows OS[/b]
[i]Please read the forenote of this tutorial if you havent[/i] After purchasing a VPS, You will be contacted by the Company providing the server with your Login Information. To connect to your VPS, You may have to use a program like PuTTy, Which is a free Telnet/SSH client for Linux like Windows Remote desktop but you are unable to view the desktop
You can download PuTTy [url=http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/]here[/url].
Install it and run it. You will need to enter your IP address. After choosing your connection type, you may be given a prompt asking for your password. If not, You will be asked to log in when connected to the server with 'sudo your_password' i think.
Well, Feedback is appreciated, Flamers go away please

Mine beats that
/flame

[hr]

Pictures are Coming. I am ordering a VPS to get pictures inside the server

I see people still ask how to set up a VPS. Most guides use VPSLand.com, I personally wouldnt use them. Now here is a guide much better then 12igon8’s guide and will provide you with more information.

I will write up a guide on setting up a VPS using a Linux computer soon

[hr]

Forenote

If you have no experience with using VPS, I advise you to get a Windows Server. Some linux VPS providers do not allow Remote Desktop type connections and will only allow SSH. So get a Windows VPS if you havent used linux before

Selecting your VPS

You should choose the VPS depending on the amount of players you have. Most servers (Delta) can run quite lagg-free on minimum 512MB of RAM (Random Access Memory). You should choose a company with a decent feedback list. I personally use Next Level These guys have very fast customer support with a support team based around the world, Very fast servers and No downtime at all. They also offer Webhosting for 2$ a month

Select your Operating System:

Linux VPS
Windows VPS

Setting up a Windows VPS on Windows OS

After purchasing a VPS, You will be contacted by the Company providing the server with your Login Information.
You will need the following to connect to your VPS

[ul][li]IP Address[/li]
[li]Username (Usually Administrator)[/li]
[li]Password[/li][/ul]

Open your ‘Start’ Menu
Windows XP+: Search for ‘run’ and open it
Windows XP-: Click ‘Run’

In the run dialog type ‘mstsc’, A box like this should pop up:

[hr]
Enter your IP Address, Let it connect. Enter your Administrator username and the password given to you and your VPS is ready to set up

Setting up a Linux VPS on Windows OS

Please read the forenote of this tutorial if you havent
After purchasing a VPS, You will be contacted by the Company providing the server with your Login Information.
To connect to your VPS, You may have to use a program like PuTTy, Which is a free Telnet/SSH client for Linux like Windows Remote desktop but you are unable to view the desktop

You can download PuTTy here.

Install it and run it. You will need to enter your IP address. After choosing your connection type, you may be given a prompt asking for your password. If not, You will be asked to log in when connected to the server with ‘sudo your_password’ i think.

Well, Feedback is appreciated, Flamers go away please
